intro: Centaurea scabiosa var. triangularis, commonly known as the triangular coneflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped flower heads, which are composed of numerous small, spiky florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly rough texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
